To optimize out the function `fn6` via function inlining, we need to replace all calls to `fn6` in the program with the body of the `fn6` function.

1. Inline `fn6` into `fn10`:
Replace `fn6(am, an)` in the line `if (((ao - (fn4(fn6(am, an), 0xECL))) - p2) & 1UL)` with `(am - an)`.

2. Inline `fn6` into `fn13`:
Replace `fn6(am, an)` in the line `if (((ao - (fn4(fn6(am, an), 0xECL))) - t) & 1UL)` with `(am - an)`.

3. Replace the `fn6` function declaration with its body:
Remove the function declaration `f fn6(f p1, f p2) { return p1 - p2; }`.

After applying these optimizations, the final modified program is:
